definition:
Given a topological space $(X,\tau)$, a *regularly open set* is an open
set $A\in \tau$ such that $$\mathrm{int}\, \overline{A}=A$$ (the
interior of the closure is the set itself).

An example of non regularly open set on the standard topology for
${\mathbbmss{R}}$ is $A=(0,1)\cup(1,2)$ since
$\mathrm{int}\overline{A}=(0,2)$.
